summary: Propzie, re: PVP video
mainText: '@Simon_Hypixel exposing my awful PvP skills in 4k.ü•≤'

summary: Simon, re: FOV feedback
mainText: 'We didn't follow the golden rule of increasing the FoV when recording a YouTube video! In-game, it didn't feel that bad, but I will keep this in mind for future videos.'

summary: Simon, re: Official Servers covering different regions
mainText: 'We will cover most regions'

summary: Simon, re: user's concerns on blocking/movement
mainText: 'yeah, same concerns here, will fix over time üòé'

summary: Simon, re: user happy Simon was enjoying the PVP
mainText: 'It's why I do it, I'm not getting paid lol'

summary: Simon, re: 1st person PVP feedback
mainText:
'Zum actually plays a lot more in 1st person than I do, with a higher FoV than shown in the video, it's better. 
Lot's of improvements will be coming in the months and years to follow :)'

summary: Simon, re: particular feedback on a PVP move
mainText: 'Hell yeah!!!'

summary: Simon, re: stuns being in PVE
mainText: 'Yep, we will probably add a stagger system later on'

summary: Simon, re: user desiring a CTF gamemode
mainText:
'Yeah, can't wait to see what game modes people come up with! 
We also got a lot of minigame of our own in the works after launch :)'

summary: Simon, re: stuns in Hytale
mainText: 'No, we tried stuns at some point, and it felt terrible and frustrating.'

summary: Simon, re: concerns over 1st-person combat
mainText:
'Honestly, 1st person PvP in melee range is always kinda tricky to balance visually - Overwatch might feel overwhelming for some, and for others it's fine.

The great thing is, for Hytale, the 3rd person view is actually fun and usable :)'

summary: Simon gives notes on PVP video
mainText:
'The video is live on YouTube - go look it up!

Here are some of my notes;

1- We are missing knockback, player/NPC collision and other core features.
2- You can adjust FoV.
3- Lots of the weapons are "op" with mobility, but it's fine and fun for early access!
4- None of the weapons are balanced yet, obviously!
5- Player health bars can be turned off client-side; we will add an option for servers to force them off as well.
6- Player health bars are rendering incorrectly and will be fixed after launch. They don't scale properly and appear too far away. They need a complete rework; they don't look great, and they should be more minimalist. 
7- Combat might feel a bit floaty at times, but it's getting better as we progress. Controls are feeling good, though.
8- Blocking mechanisms are not done yet; you can block a full signature hit with low stam with daggers. 

And the list goes on and on and on! Told you guys this is early access! 

However, we are AWARE and will fix it all over time. Give us a couple of months, and you will get some very good PvP in Hytale. We love playing the game and will keep at it for years to come!'

summary: Buddha, re: Mosshorn appearing in the PVP video
mainText: 'Starting off 2026 with a Mosshorn Photo Bomb üíï'

summary: Simon, re: option to disable helmet visibility but keep protection
mainText: 'Long-term, I'd love it, but we want to consider the implications of PvP, though.'

summary: Simon, re: Olegro asking about death penalties
mainText:
'It can be configured; by default, you lose some materials/durability but keep your items. 

For example, you might lose 50% of your ore and 10% of your durability on death. 

You can turn it all off and have no downside to dying when you create your world (not sure if we can do that before launch).'

summary: Simon, re: blocks breaking in combat
mainText:
'It depends on the blocks; leaves, for example, can be broken with weapons. Bushes/vases etc. 

Otherwise, you would accidentally break your house lol.'

summary: Simon, re: Olegro asking if weapons have durability
mainText:
'We are not sure whether we will use durability for weapons, but in exploration mode, it doesn't matter much. 
Servers can do whatever they want; it takes 1 line to change it.'

summary: Simon, re: user liking the weapon movements
mainText: 'It's really fun, just need to balance so it doesn't become a travel method lol'

summary: Simon, re: user asking if health bars can be disabled
mainText: 'Client side, yes; server side, soon.'

summary: Simon, re: feedback on PVP video
mainText: 'Player health bars are rendering incorrectly and not scaling properly. Also, servers will have the option to turn immersion on or off (maybe not for launch, we have too much urgent stuff to fix).'

summary: Slikey, re: Server Manual
mainText: 'It's not in the original file, I copied it over to notepad and it somehow added the escape during that lol'

summary: Simon, re: feedback on PVP video
mainText: 'Knockback and collision are missing. This is SUPER early, guys.'

summary: Simon, re: user saying WoW Arena maps would be cool for Hytale
mainText: 'Zum (Hytale game designer) and I were WoW arena duo in WoW: TBC! Good old days!'

summary: Slikey, re: Server Manual
mainText:
'Writing that at the moment - it'll be available pretty soon but obviously not useful to actually get setup as you will need the game files to actually host the server.
It will allow you to familiarize yourself though.'

(Image showcasing start of Manual)

summary: Slikey, re: Linux
mainText: 'For now, you will download the flatpak from the Website - we are looking at flathub but we consider it QoL, so it has lower priority. Any steps we can skip, we skip üòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: user offering to edit the videos for Simon
mainText: 'I do it because I enjoy it though üòÖ'

summary: Slikey, re: Linux/MacOS Support
mainText:
'RE: Linux & Mac Support

üêßLinux:
We are launching with Linux (x64, not ARM) support using flatpak. We are launching the native Linux and given the diversity of the Linux ecosystem, we are treating the Linux launch as "experimental".
We have programmers on the team who natively work on Hytale using Linux, so expect support to expand and improve.
System requirements should be similar to Windows - RAM requirements may be lower due to Windows usually hogging more memory as an OS.
So all in all, you will be able to download Hytale for Linux, you will be able to install it and run it but chances are there may be some issues you run into that are super specific to your distro. We rely on reports to fix those issues. 
We have not tried and won't try Proton. Given that we don't do any kernel-level anticheat, you will probably be able to run it via a compatibility layer too but that's for the community to find out.
One test was conducted on a Steamdeck with attached docking station (Monitor, Keyboard, Mouse) and got well playable results in local singleplayer. (Steamdeck is NOT officially recommended as there is NO CONTROLLER SUPPORT YET).

üçéMac: 
We WOULD be ready to launch for native MacOS (Apple Silicon / M Chips) - however we are missing the signing certificate. The ticket keeps being reset in the queue and we have to keep calling them. 
System requirements are work in progress - we have tried it on M3+ at the moment and we are working our way back in time to find the lowest limit. We will NOT launch Hytale for Intel Macs as Apple themselves abandon them in the next MacOS version. We are a small team and there is no way we can support abandoned platforms.
So for Mac, we use it internally to play on and even work on it but ultimately we have no way to ship it without the certificate. As soon as we have it, we will update you.

We will update the requirements on blog & store in the coming days.'

summary: Simon, re: PVP video
mainText:
'I edited myself, and you will notice some audio is cut, muffled, or acting up because of the language we used. I did my best to clean it up!

Note that we didn‚Äôt use potions, food, traps, totems, blocks or magic. We‚Äôre really just testing the fundamentals and getting a feel for the core combat. We‚Äôll add many more features and work closely with PvPers to ensure combat feels right and continues to improve over the years. We aim to bring a range of PvP minigames and support the community in creating their own PvP content. 

What I'm really excited about is seeing the community revive classic PvP modes like Bed Wars, Survival Games, Skywars, UHC, Extractions and more. 

Not only am I working on the game, business, and partnerships, but I'm also learning DaVinci Resolve in my free time to deliver you guys some raw footage. I'm in the trenches, boisüòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: user saying he should rest
mainText: 'working on Hytale is my peace'

summary: Simon, re: KC asking if fireworks will be in the game

'In the Spawn Particle menu, you can find some firework effects; none are currently being used (we cleaned up a lot of old/broken items). 
Reasonably easy to make a Firework Launcher, attach some particles to it!'

summary: Slikey, re: MacOS support
mainText: 'No word from Apple. üò°'

summary: Slikey, re: if the server source commits will cover the last seven years
mainText: 'No, we will squash it on release. We want to avoid speculation or discussion about historical code.'

summary: Slikey, re: changelogs
mainText: 'There are 2 things: The patch notes with release builds and when the server source is published you also get commits as part of the Github repository. So you will be able to see those changes come in.'

summary: Slikey, re: Java having NativeAOT
mainText: 'It doesn't yet - it has a different AOT but given the time frame we are talking about we don't know what options we have then. It may be that there is a way to compile it down to native code by then and thus making the entire conversation redundant.'

summary: Ktar, re: tint brush feature
mainText: 'Yup. Still in the game. There's a brush called the "tint brush" that allows you to paint tints. There's also commands.'

summary: Slikey, re: hypothetical future version of Hytale that breaks significant number of mods, like 1.12/1.13 of MC
mainText: 'I wouldn't worry about any such breakage like that. We are so far from it that the path is blurry and we will figure out the best way forward together with the community when the time comes. We may not need it because Java has NativeAOT, or we have Java and C# or we have a perfect C# port or we just don't care about offline singleplayer. So many hypotheticals.. We make the game perfect first before we worry about any of that.'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking why C# is only used for Hytale's client
mainText: 'Historical - if we did it again today, we'd pick C# for client and server but for now it's fine. We can make the game perfect like this and maybe one day - in many years - we have better options to support Java and C# servers :) On Minecraft there are many different servers and we can have a lot of diversity with servers.'

summary: Slikey, re: LAN play without internet
mainText: 'You can, but there is no good flow for putting the server into offline mode yet. It may be a bit more difficult and require additional work to get a proper offline LAN experience. Technically possible but not trivial yet.'

summary: Simon, re: user asking why abandon the C++ engine forever
mainText: 'It's years behind and no longer has any upsides.'

summary: Simon, re: how he feels getting Hytale back
mainText:
'People ask me how I feel about getting Hytale back and getting closer to release. Honestly, the transparent answer is anger.

The game has insane potential, but four years of engineering went into rebuilding the engine rather than gameplay features. That leaves us with a four-year gap and a lot of catching up to do, and that rebuilt engine is never gonna be used. 

When you don‚Äôt invest in gameplay, you don‚Äôt just lose time. You lose momentum, iteration, and player feedback. Now the focus has to be on gameplay first and rebuilding trust by actually shipping things at a rapid pace.

It‚Äôs a damn miracle we were able to salvage Hytale. It was barely playable. All basics were broken. Camera, movement, combat, crafting, building, gameloop, sounds, rendering. Everything, everything was wrong.

It should have taken years to fix, but within weeks, we got the game into a playable, fun state. And now, instead of slowing down or celebrating a release, we have to keep pushing for years to make up for the time that was lost.

So yes, I feel anger. And I‚Äôm turning that into focus and execution. I‚Äôm committing more money, more time, and personal sacrifice to deliver the game this vision deserves.'

summary: Slikey, re: programming language usage
mainText:
'Depends on what you want to do. It's a bit like power tools. Are you a carpenter or mason?

Web / Backend Service -> Go
High Performance Libraries -> Rust / C++
AI / ML -> Python
Reverse Engineering -> ASM / Ghidra'

summary: Slikey, re: user saying Java will be pried from their cold dead hands
mainText:
'I love Java for how flexible it's runtime is. It's a great language but by the lord I wish Project Valhalla would finally move in it's grave. https://openjdk.org/projects/valhalla/
'

summary: Slikey, re: user asking for C++ engine source dump for fun
mainText: 'Won't be possible as the SDKs from Nintendo, Sony and Microsoft were all in there for multiplatform support. Those are under NDA and any attempt to make it functional without it, would be a waste of time. We have maybe looked at the engine ~5 times over the past few months.'
